docs.snippet: An assailant using a bow and a threepronged arrow with razor blades at the end of each prong seriously wounded a man in the back yesterday as he started down the steps of the Botanic Garden subway station in Brooklyn. The 27-inch arrow was aluminu...
docs.lead_paragraph: An assailant using a bow and a threepronged arrow with razor blades at the end of each prong seriously wounded a man in the back yesterday as he started down the steps of the Botanic Garden subway station in Brooklyn. The 27-inch arrow was aluminum and the razor blades were attached with wires.
docs.abstract: Assailant using bow and arrow seriously wounds Alexander Hudson at Botanical Garden subway station in Brooklyn (M)

headline.main: Witness Is Struck by Arrow On Brooklyn Subway Steps; Surgeons Remove Shaft

docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON ALTHOUGH ladies are now toler ated, to a certain extent, and "the" has been dropped, not much has changed since those words were written in 1848 about the apartment house carved from an opulent 18th-century mansion that is one of the most sought-after addresses in London.

headline.main: Near Piccadilly's Din, A Haven of Elegance

docs.snippet: NEWARK, Feb. 27--The Government pushed forward its investigation of corruption in the United States Customs Service today by obtaining an eighth admission of guilt and agreement to cooperate with the investigation....
docs.lead_paragraph: NEWARK, Feb. 27--The Government pushed forward its investigation of corruption in the United States Customs Service today by obtaining an eighth admission of guilt and agreement to cooperate with the investigation.
docs.abstract: Ferruccio M Lisoni, manager of NYC clothing importing company, pleads guilty in Government inquiry into corruption in US Customs Service; he is 8th person to plead guilty and agree to cooperate; admits to arranging for delivery of goods to Leonard Grant, Customs Service area director in NJ; Grant has been suspended but not formally indicted yet (M)

headline.main: EIGHTH ADMITS GUILT IN CUSTOMS INQUIRY; Suspended Director of Jersey Area Is Implicated Second Time in Illegal Taking of Goods Second Mention of Grant Thefts of Wine and Liquor

byline.original: By JILL SMOLOWE Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: A transit policeman and a city policeman were wounded by gunfire in Brooklyn yesterday when the transit policeman tried to stop a disturbance on a bus. Three civilians helped capture a suspect who had tried to seek refuge in an ice cream store....
docs.lead_paragraph: A transit policeman and a city policeman were wounded by gunfire in Brooklyn yesterday when the transit policeman tried to stop a disturbance on a bus. Three civilians helped capture a suspect who had tried to seek refuge in an ice cream store.
docs.abstract: NYC transit police officer Oscar Soto is wounded by gunfire in Brooklyn when he trys to stop disturbance on bus; J civilians help capture suspect Bernard Proctor; attack, at Church and Nostrand Avenues, brings to 9 number of city and transit policemen shot since January 28; Deputy Chief Edward J Stoll Jr comments; incident described; city police officer Peter Mulligan, assisting Soto, was also shot; Eric Head, Juan Ortega and Mario Chase were civilians who helped in capture; Stoll says Proctor will probably be charged with attempted murder and assault; Proctor and Soto are reported in stable condition; Mulligan illus (M)

headline.main: 2 Officers Shot in Brooklyn; Civilians Help Seize Suspect; Week's Second Such Attack How the Civilians Helped

docs.snippet: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 25 As expected, "Kramer vs. Kramer" took the lion's share of the 1979 Academy Award nominations today. Its nine nominations included best picture, Dustin Hoffman as actor, Robert Benton as director and screenwriter, Justin Henry ...
docs.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 25 As expected, "Kramer vs. Kramer" took the lion's share of the 1979 Academy Award nominations today. Its nine nominations included best picture, Dustin Hoffman as actor, Robert Benton as director and screenwriter, Justin Henry as supporting actor and Jane Alexander and Meryl Streep as supporting actresses.

headline.main: 'Kramer' and 'Jazz' Top Oscar Nominees; 'China Syndrome' Fizzes Henry, at 8, Is Youngest Nominee 'Cage' Eligible for Other Awards

byline.original: By ALJEAN HARMETZ Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Feb. 25  Bobby Brown calls the route to the major leagues "the road of success." His trip began at age 18; now he is three months from 26, with what Dick Howser, the Yankee manager, calls "a good opportunity" to play in the ...
docs.lead_paragraph: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Feb. 25 Bobby Brown calls the route to the major leagues "the road of success." His trip began at age 18; now he is three months from 26, with what Dick Howser, the Yankee manager, calls "a good opportunity" to play in the outfield next summer.

headline.main: Bobby Brown: Long Detours on His Journey to Yankee Outfield; At Last, the Big Town Is This the Year? A Dangerous Label Piniella Has Competition

byline.original: By MALCOLM MORAN Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: SAN SALVADOR, Feb. 24--United States officials said today that intense pressure from Washington appeared to have temporarily headed off a planned right-wing coup against El Salvador's military-civilian junta....
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN SALVADOR, Feb. 24--United States officials said today that intense pressure from Washington appeared to have temporarily headed off a planned right-wing coup against El Salvador's military-civilian junta.
docs.abstract: US officials say that intense pressure from Carter Administration appears to have temporarily headed off planned right-wing military coup against military-civilian junta; say situation remains serious, with right-wing business and political groups seemingly determined to block social changes planned by junta, which is struggling to forestall a popular insurrection; Archbishop Oscar Arnulfo Romero of San Salvador says right-wing terrorists are linked to 'oligarchy,' code word for small group of wealthy families that have long controlled both economy and politics (M)

headline.main: U.S. Is Said to Block El Salvador Coup, but Situation Remains Serious
